column4: hey my class is trying to get ubuntu running on a bunch pentum 2s any advise
get the alternate CD, do a "server" install from the alternate CD, then work up a GUI from there (fluxbox, blackbox, whatever)
yes, it'll be a normall ubuntu system, just with only a command line, at first
the first link there has a link to a grub CD (scroll all te way down)
your home partition will be where you put all your stuff
is it going to be the only OS on there?
give /home the rest of the space from your other partitions
does it work anywhere?  like grub? or anything?

right, but does it only not work in a GUI? what we're trying to figure out is if it's software or hardware.  Will it work editing a grub entry (within grub, hit escape, hit e type space, etc).  If not, then I imagine it's hardware.  Take apart your keyboard, clean it, etc etc
ctrl-alt-f1 will get you a real terminal, ctrl-alt-f7 gets you back to the GUI.  but that still might have the same issues, as youre going through linux
the same software issues, that is.
alright, well, at least now you know its a software thing, and X>=  as for fixing it, I... have no idea.
regular reasons to use a 64bit OS
um, well, some of them would include ability to use more than 4GB RAM
you can only use 4GB of ram on the standard version of ubuntu?
4GB of ram is a limitation of 32bit processors, on any OS
